article.title: Galaxy @ BioHackathon-Europe 2019
article.content:
[](https://github.com/elixir-europe/BioHackathon-projects-2019/tree/master/projects/7)



[](https://github.com/elixir-europe/BioHackathon-projects-2019/tree/master/projects/17)



[](https://github.com/elixir-europe/BioHackathon-projects-2019/tree/master/projects/31)
[](https://www.biohackathon-europe.org/index.html)

[](https://github.com/elixir-europe/BioHackathon-projects-2019/tree/master/projects/8)


[](https://github.com/elixir-europe/BioHackathon-projects-2019/tree/master/projects/3)
[](https://github.com/elixir-europe/BioHackathon-projects-2019/tree/master/projects/19)

Galaxy will be featured at BioHackathon-Europe 2019 as a prominent part of many of this year's selected projects:

  • Interoperable Workflows for Communities

    • Organizers: Frederik Coppens, Björn Grüning, Marek Suchánek, Rob Hooft

  • Improve the support of Common Workflow Language in Galaxy

    • Organizers: Hervé Ménager, John Chilton, Michael Crusoe

  • Towards seamless Galaxy and InterMine integration: Enhanced region analysis

    • Organizers: Yo Yehudi

  • Scalable delivery of FAIR training in Life Sciences using Galaxy and the Carpentries training material

    • Organizers: Helena Rasche, Saskia Hiltemann, Bérénice Batut

  • Gallantries Project: Galaxy + Carpentries for Scalable Training

    • Organizers: Helena Rasche, Saskia Hiltemann, Bérénice Batut

  • Development of a Pulsar toolkit

    • Organizers: Gianmauro Cuccuru, Marco Antonio Tangaro

  • Updating the Galaksio workflow management interface for Galaxy and migrating it to Vue.js

    • Organizers: Tomas Klingstrom

  • A graph database of Galaxy tool interoperability

    • Organizers: Wolfgang Maier, Jon Ison

  • Bioconda and Biocontainers helpdesk

    • Organizers: Björn Grüning, Devon Ryan

Join us to learn from and work with experts of the Open Source Life Science community, and discuss the future of the ELIXIR Galaxy community and enjoy the great food and venue.

Interested? Registration is available on a first come, first serve basis. Registration is free, but space is limited. Register now.
